byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and THOMAS KAPLAN

abstract: Position of New York Senate Majority Leader Dean G Skelos has grown dire as fellow Republicans withdraw support and call for him to step down; Skelos, who was arrested along with his son Adam on corruption charges, is not expected to remain in post much longer; exact terms of withdrawal are unclear as Republicans gather in closed-door sessions.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Skelos, the Republican leader, is not expected to keep his post beyond Monday, though it was not clear how, and under what terms, his tenure would end.

headline.main: Dean Skelos Faces Growing Opposition as Support Wanes Among Republicans
headline.print_headline: Senate Majority Leader Faces Growing Opposition as Republican Support Recedes

snippet: Mr. Skelos, the Republican leader, is not expected to keep his post beyond Monday, though it was not clear how, and under what terms, his tenure would end.
